page.title: 04Sheep Farming
page.content: There are also Sheep Farms in the Bagnall area and the sheep are kept for their wool and their meat. The sheep are sheared once a year.Many years ago the sheep were sheared with clippers,now the farmers have installed electic shears . Twice a year the sheep are dipped.It is now the job of the police to ensure that the sheep are dipped properly.When the sheep are due for a dipping the farmers contact the police to make sure that they will be present when they dip their sheep. When the sheep are dipped they are put in pens and then in turn they are pushed into a large troth like bath containing disinfectant.Here their body is held under the water for around 3 minutes to ensure that all diseases have been neutralized.
